From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
Yam language of Papua New Guinea
For the Neme language of Oro province, see Aneme Wake language.
Not to be confused with Nema language.
Neme
RegionWestern Province (Papua New Guinea)
Native speakers
200 (2018)[1]
Language family
Yam
  • Nambu
    • Neme
Language codes
ISO 639-3nex
Glottologneme1244
Neme is classified as Severely Endangered by the UNESCO Atlas of the World's Languages in Danger.

Neme (or Dorro, Karigari, Moi-e ~ Moive) is a Yam language spoken in Western Province, Papua New Guinea.

References

[edit]
